summary: This document is an email chain from October 4, 2022, between FBI personnel and a UK journalist, Matthew Dresch. The journalist is inquiring about information and a photograph related to Jeffrey Epstein's New York apartment at 301 East 66th Street, which he states was used to keep victims. The internal FBI discussion focuses on whether to provide the photo and answer questions.

persons.name: Matthew Dresch
persons.context: A reporter from the Daily Mirror newspaper in the UK who emailed the FBI to request information and a photograph related to Jeffrey Epstein's New York apartment, stating it was used to keep victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI probe. The journalist's inquiry is about his apartment at 301 East 66th Street in New York, which is alleged to have been used to keep victims.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry to FBI about Epstein Apartment
events.description: Matthew Dresch, a journalist from the Daily Mirror, sends an email to the FBI requesting information and a photograph related to Jeffrey Epstein's New York apartment, citing its alleged use for holding victims.

locations: 301 East 66th Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's apartment)
keyFacts: A UK journalist contacted the FBI in 2022 seeking information on Jeffrey Epstein's New York apartment at 301 East 66th Street.
The journalist stated he had 'been told he used to keep victims there,' referencing an alleged use of the property.
The journalist referenced a specific FBI file (Part 19 or 22, page 21) and requested a full-color version of a picture from page 20.
Internal FBI emails show deliberation on whether to provide the requested photograph and answer the journalist's questions.
